DataElement.preferredName: Negation Ability Patient Compliance Immunology And Clinical Follow-up Exclusion Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions that address medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study related to the inability of a patient to conform to immunological and clinical follow-up activities.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Negation Ability Patient Compliance Immunology And Clinical Follow-up Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment._The extent to which a patient conforms to medical advice regarding prescribed regimen, lifestyle, dietary changes, follow-up schedule and other recommendations._The study of the body's immune system._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done._Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.:The extent to which a patient conforms to medical advice regarding prescribed regimen, lifestyle, dietary changes, follow-up schedule and other recommendations.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.
The extent to which a patient conforms to medical advice regarding prescribed regimen, lifestyle, dietary changes, follow-up schedule and other recommendations.

Property.preferredName: Immunology And Clinical Follow-up Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The study of the body's immune system.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.:Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

Concepts.definition: The study of the immune system and its reaction to pathogens, as well as its malfunctions (autoimmune diseases, allergies, rejection of organ transplants).
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

The non-affirmative response to a question.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to comply with immunological and clinical follow up assessment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there a strong likelihood (known) of non-adherence (such as difficulties in adhering to follow-up schedule due to geographic distance from the treatment facility)?
